item.title: TomTom introduces a new fitness tracker that can measure body composition
item.description: Source: TomTom. The TomTom Touch. The TomTom company has introduced a new fitness tracker in Singapore. This device is the first of its kind to track body composition, steps, sleep, and heart rate all day right from the user’s wrist. Monitoring body composition helps users understand their fitness levels and how those levels change. Before the TomTom Touch, this metric could only be measured using special scales or expensive devices.

item.title: ASICS introduces its lightest-ever cushioning shoe for runners
item.description: Source: ASICS. The DynaFlyte. ASICS has released its lightest cushioned running shoe to date. The DynaFlyte combines lightness and cushioning with a full-length FlyteFoam midsole, utilizing the company’s patented midsole technology in its most basic form. According to ASICS, the shoe’s reduced weight minimizes energy loss during the stride, resulting in more efficient running and the potential for increased speed at any distance. Balancing efficient cushioning with minimizing weight is a significant challenge in running shoe design.

item.title: Atari guarantees a fitness app that incorporates gamification
item.description: Atari, a company known for interactive entertainment, is launching Atari Fit™, a fitness app with gaming elements, in early 2015. Atari collaborated with certified personal trainer Michael Porter to create over 150 exercises for the app, including circuit training, running programs, and personalized routines. Users can earn points by exercising alone or with friends to unlock classic Atari games such as Pong, Centipede, and Super Breakout. Porter highlights that all exercise routines within Atari Fit are certified, ensuring their safety and effectiveness.

item.title: Globetrekker Challenge creates a wellness portal for Garmin in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: Globetrekker Challenge, a Singapore-based corporate wellness software company, will provide their corporate wellness platform to Garmin for distribution across Asia and the Pacific. This collaboration leverages each company’s strengths, allowing them to focus on their core offerings. Globetrekker’s platform offers customizable wellness programs, real-time analytics reporting, and health risk profiling for employers. Through this partnership, Garmin’s clients can access these features and integrate them with Garmin’s wearable devices, creating a comprehensive employee health improvement solution.

item.title: Actxa Spur makes training in your heart rate zone easier
item.description: Actxa has launched the Spur, a wearable fitness tracker that continuously monitors heart rate and provides zone indication. The Spur aims to make heart rate zone training accessible to everyone, not just athletes, by offering a user-friendly alternative to chest straps. For years, fitness enthusiasts and athletes have used heart rate as a measure of workout intensity. A higher heart rate generally indicates a more intense workout. The Spur uses a wrist-based sensor to measure resting heart rate and track different heart rate zones: Warm Up, Fat Burning, Cardio, Intense, and Maximum.

item.title: Garmin introduces three new fēnix 5 multisport GPS wearables
item.description: Source: Garmin. The fēnix 5 family of multisport GPS watches. Garmin International has released the fēnix 5, fēnix 5S, and fēnix 5X multisport GPS watches. These wearables are designed for adventurers of all sizes. Each fēnix 5 model offers 24/7 wearability, extended battery life, daily activity tracking*, Garmin Elevate wrist heart rate technology, and various connected features**. At 47mm, the fēnix 5 is more compact than past models like the fēnix 3HR, while still providing extensive multisport features.

item.title: New website offers discounted gym classes in Melbourne
item.description: Source: FILLMYCLASS. Similar to discounts for last-minute travel bookings, you can find more affordable gym classes at the last minute too. A new website called FILLMYCLASS has launched in Melbourne, Australia. This website connects fitness enthusiasts with open spots in fitness classes at gyms and studios nearby. FILLMYCLASS founder Daniel Waide states, “It’s all about flexibility. The aim is to encourage more people to be active. Offering the ability to select classes that fit their schedule at any gym or studio increases the likelihood of people becoming and staying active.

item.title: Increase your productivity by installing a treadmill at your desk
item.description: A recent study featured in the journal Plos One found that using a treadmill desk could lead to higher productivity compared to a traditional desk setup. [Image of a treadmill desk] Source: Plos One This study, titled “Treadmill Workstations: The Effects of Walking while Working on Physical Activity and Work Performance”, was conducted by researchers from the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities, University of Texas-Arlington, Mayo Clinic, and Arizona State University. Over 12 months, they observed the impact of treadmill desks on physical activity and work output at a financial services company.

item.title: Intel-powered SMS Audio headphones will monitor fitness
item.description: Intel and SMS Audio, a headphone and accessories company founded by Curtis “50 Cent” Jackson, have teamed up to create the SMS Audio BioSport In-Ear Headphones powered by Intel. This new personal audio system aims to blend technology with fitness. These headphones, part of the recently introduced SMS Audio Sport Collection, are engineered to provide high-quality audio while simultaneously collecting valuable fitness data. Michael Bell, Corporate VP and GM of the New Devices Group at Intel, emphasized the significance of this collaboration, stating that it signifies Intel’s commitment to leading innovation in wearable technology and merging lifestyle with technology.

item.title: Kinetika Xtreme is unveiling innovative workout technology designed to enhance fitness levels
item.description: Ghaneswaran Sukumaran holds a certification from Italy and is one of only two TechnoGym Master Trainers in Singapore. His wife, Santhi Haridass, is the other. As the owner of Kinetika Xtreme, a gym in Singapore’s Turf City that specializes in movement-based functional training, Sukumaran expresses concern that many individuals join gyms without proper research and engage in exercises that may be detrimental in the long term. “Many people equate weight loss with fat loss and believe that excessive jogging is the key to achieving a slim physique.

item.title: Making small changes to your lifestyle can lead to a healthier you in the long run, according to Herbalife
item.description: People in Asia are interested in expanding their fitness routines beyond traditional practices like yoga and tai chi. However, Samantha Clayton, Director of Worldwide Fitness Education at Herbalife, notes that they face unique challenges, such as extreme weather and demanding work schedules, and need to adapt their fitness routines accordingly. She emphasizes the importance of integrating fitness into everyday life, especially when environmental factors like air quality, heat, and humidity can be obstacles.

item.title: Get in shape for the beach at Kata Rocks in Phuket with New Year workouts in 2015
item.description: Kata Rocks, a luxurious and modern resort in Phuket, has introduced a New Year’s fitness program designed to help guests achieve their “beach body” goals. The program, which costs THB10,000 (US$305) per day, takes place at one of Thailand’s most advanced fitness centers. It’s overseen by Callum McGregor, an accomplished personal trainer and former British special forces Commando. McGregor, who also boasts titles in strongman competitions and military powerlifting, specializes in strength training, fitness, weight loss, and toning.

item.title: The latest Apple watches have the capability to contact someone in case of a fall
item.description: Apple has released the Apple Watch Series 4, a redesigned smartwatch focused on connectivity, activity tracking, and health management. Maintaining its classic look, the fourth iteration boasts a 30% larger screen and a smaller, slimmer casing. This model introduces advanced fitness and communication features with watchOS 5, a new accelerometer and gyroscope for fall detection, and an electrical heart rate sensor that enables electrocardiograms (ECGs) through the new ECG app.

item.title: Fit Spotting assists users in finding hotels that have excellent gym facilities
item.description: Fit Spotting is an iOS mobile application that helps users discover, evaluate, and read reviews about hotel gyms and fitness facilities. Tarek Atwan, the creator of Fit Spotting, explained that as a frequent traveler and fitness enthusiast, he found it challenging to locate reliable reviews and images of hotel gyms while booking accommodations. Information was scattered across the internet, lacking a central platform where users could access consolidated feedback, ratings, and photos to accurately depict the hotel’s fitness offerings.

item.title: CruCycle brings a fresh perspective to the fitness scene in Singapore
item.description: Krewfit recently introduced CruCycle, a new spin studio concept in Singapore, to fitness and fun enthusiasts. The studio’s classes operate on the principle of “Riding with the Pack,” emphasizing group workouts, teamwork, and camaraderie. This makes CruCycle’s workouts perfect for corporate team-building events. Source: Crucycle. The Ding siblings – Valerie, Calvin, and Beatrice – founded, own, and operate CruCycle. The inspiration for the studio came from their upbringing in Los Angeles, California.

item.title: Introducing the new BioSport In-Ear headphones, now in stock
item.description: Source: Intel. The BioSport In-Ear headphones are now available, developed through a partnership between SMS Audio and Intel. These headphones provide high-quality audio while simultaneously tracking fitness progress. The headphones monitor heart rate through integrated biometric sensors, allowing users to monitor their fitness journey and strive for peak performance. BioSport headphones take in-ear technology to the next level. Their ear-wing design fits securely in the ear canal for constant heart rate monitoring in real time.

item.title: TomTom's latest Spark GPS fitness watches also have the capability to play music
item.description: Source: TomTom. TomTom has introduced the Spark GPS fitness watch line. These new watches include a 3GB music player, making it simpler for fitness enthusiasts to enhance their workouts by listening to music directly from their wrist. The TomTom Spark GPS fitness watch can stream music to a variety of Bluetooth headphones. It also includes a preloaded thirty-minute Running Trax curated by Ministry of Sound. Users can easily download playlists to the TomTom Spark from iTunes or Windows Media Player.

item.title: Introducing the Healthy MICE Programme by SilverNeedle Hospitality
item.description: To address the increasing demand for healthier options at conferences, SilverNeedle Hospitality is launching “Healthy Minds, Healthy Thinking,” a new MICE (Meetings, Incentives, Conferences, and Exhibitions) program. Watermelon salad This program is being launched in response to a survey of 85 event organizers, in which 93% indicated that healthy food choices were a significant factor in their venue selection process. “‘Our Healthy Minds, Healthy Thinking’ program came about because of a real need in the MICE sector,” explained Iqbal Jumabhoy, Managing Director and Group CEO of SilverNeedle Hospitality.

item.title: Adidas introduces black clothing featuring heat management technology
item.description: Source: adidas. Climachill apparel. Adidas recently debuted its new Climachill clothing line, featuring a black training t-shirt designed with technology that regulates body heat to keep wearers cool in hot weather. Ideal for warm and humid weather, Adidas Climachill maximizes cooling without sacrificing comfort or style. Dr. Maarten Hupperets, Director of Future Sport Science at Adidas, explains, “When we exercise, our body’s core temperature can rise by 3 degrees Celsius.
